accomplishments: Developed iOS & Android frameworks to scan the barcodes in driver’s licenses to report metadata for identification purposes.

Combined the above Android & iOS frameworks into a Xamarin.Forms library and developed tutorials on doing such, which enabled DraftKings’ Xamarin team to leverage the power of native mobile libraries.
Added new features to DraftKings’ iOS app’s login flow using the VIPER architecture to improve user experiences.

Designed and programmed an iOS App with an Apple Watch counterpart, Beatslytics, and published it on the App Store. The app enables the user to rediscover their music with relevant analytics information about their music library.
Currently a registered Apple Developer Program member.
Designed & Implemented a database schema to store analytics information on device, using the CoreData persistence framework from Apple.
Developed a fully functional music player as a subset of features offered by Beatslytics, with the MediaPlayer framework.
Gained familiarity with using iTunes Connect to publish an app to the App Store.
Apply graphic design skills in creating logos, posters, brochures, and other designs using Adobe Illustrator, Adobe InDesign and Adobe Photoshop.
Networked with clubs & organizations to accommodate for special graphic design needs.

Worked as an iOS developer to maintain three apps from Modernizing Medicine: PocketEMA, Telehealth and Kiosk, with Swift and Objective-C. These apps directly improve the lives of more than 160 million patients.
Designed and implemented new features, new UI elements and carried out bug fixes while collaborating closely with a full-scale Scrum team.
Worked as an undergraduate researcher to develop iOS apps for viewing 3D models in a classroom setting, using cutting-edge technologies involving Augmented Reality.
Adopted core iOS frameworks such as SceneKit & Model I/O for 3D model viewing, and ARKit for the augmented reality experience.
Created a networking layer to interact with REST APIs with URLSession and Alamofire.
Designed UI and UX for the app from scratch.
Used CocoaPods to integrate third-party libraries into the app. For example, The app utilized Alamofire to fetch 3D models from the CSDT API. Fetched models are then visualized with AR.
